body_html:
Recently I had a segfault when training, shortly after that the system would freeze. This happened a few times in the past but very rare (once every month). A kernel update did not fix the problem, it seems. The log files say something about a locked page or a removed page.

syslog-jul-25.txt

Did anyone with threadripper have the same issue?
I know I will have to post somewhere else it is probably not pytorch issue but was just wondering since some here have similar hardware and use case.

Recently I had a segfault when training, shortly after that the system would freeze. This happened a few times in the past but very rare (once every month). A kernel update did not fix the problem, it seems. The log files say something about a locked page or a removed page. 

[syslog-jul-25.txt](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/files/2228267/syslog-jul-25.txt)

Did anyone with threadripper have the same issue? 
I know I will have to post somewhere else it is probably not pytorch issue but was just wondering since some here have similar hardware and use case.
